civics.name: Emission Permits 2.0
civics.description:
This law manages air pollution with an Emission Permits system.

The "EP Tracking" account is ONLY used for tracking your own pollution. No actual transactions are done with it!
The Treasury is used for actual holding and distribution of EP.

The first section enforces that you need EP to pollute, and it tracks the EP you consume as a fake tax. It also permits every citizen to pollute until they emitted 5-10 PPM in their tracked amount
The second section decays old EP debt and calculates the epPercentage, used for later distribution. Valid amounts are 0 - 100, meaning 0 - 100%.
The epPercentage is not the absolute percentage as the restriction of a max percentage can lead to the sum of all percentages being lower than 100%. Therefore the sum of all percentages is used instead.

properties.Title: Tracking and Preventing Pollution
properties.UserDescription:
Track PPM emitted via a suspended EP tax that will never actually be collected.
There are four different cases that are handled here:1. the citizen is in a cooperative and the amount of EPs in the company is smaller than the tax accrued -> pollution is prevented
2. the citizen is in a cooperative but there are still unused EP in the companys possession -> pollution is tracked
3. the citizen is not in a cooperative and his EPs are less than what he used -> pollution is prevented
4. the citizen is not in a cooperative and he has still unused EPs -> pollution is tracked

Case 1 and 3 are handled in the first if-branch. Cases 2 and 4 are handled together in the else-branch.Your actual EP are used before the 5k limit is invoked. Therefore, the condition for the tax into treasury is that your wealth is still higher than taxes owed.
Technically the current PPM of this tick should be added on top of the taxes owed when comparing but we ignore it for simplicity's sake

properties.Title: EP Decay & Priority calculation
properties.UserDescription: Every 1, pollution is decayed by 2.85%, leading to a half life between 12h and 1 day. The decay rate is determined. There is a limit to the maximum percentage a citizen can reach: no more than 50 PPM is considered. EP percentages below 0.1% are ignored (18.75 to 37.5 EP per hour) to not clog up distribution.

properties.Title: EP Redistribution
properties.UserDescription:
Every 1 hour, pull in all EP from all citizens. Then distribute between 18,75k (450k / 24) and 37,5k of them based on the calculated percentages. The distributed amount is determined through the usual overprovisioning, by comparing the air pollution in the last 24h with the target of 450k. If we polluted too much, this will result in underprovisioning, but that should never happen realistically as the EP barrier is a natural stopper.
If a citizen joins a cooperative, their EP share is sent to the cooperative instead.

properties.Title: Technical - moving the Tax into a Custom Stat
properties.UserDescription: We use taxes as a workaround to track global pollution. Every civics tick, they are written into a custom stat so we can actually use them. This reduces the tracking effort on the stat DB to 12 transactions per hour, from 1 transaction per machine and 30 seconds.

properties.Title: Technical - Receive Debug Info about the EPs
properties.UserDescription: Citizens can enter !epinfo to receive information about the current status of the EP systemInfo given:- current utilization: how efficiently the global resource air pollution is being consumed. Ideal amount is 450 PPM per day. Close to 100% is best if resource constrained.
